{{wikipedia|futon}}
==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ふ|とん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
{{m|ja|布||cloth|tr=ふ, fu|sc=Jpan}}
+ {{m|ja|団||mass|tr=とん, ton|sc=Jpan}}

The kanji are {{ja-ateji|sort=ふとん}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|ふとん|y=irr}}
* {{audio|Ja-Futon.oga|Audio|lang=ja}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ふとん}}

# [[futon]], a Japanese style mattress and duvet used in [[tatami]] rooms.
#: {{ja-usex|[[布団を敷く|'''布団'''を敷く]]。|[[ふとん を しく|'''^ふとん''' を しく]]。|To [[make the bed|make the '''bed''']].}}
#: {{ja-usex|'''布団'''をあげる。|^'''ふとん''' を あげる。|Put away the '''bedding'''.}}

====Usage notes====
* {{lang|ja|布団}} refers to the mattress itself, which in Japan is the entire bed – there is no wooden bed frame as in Western beds or Western-style futons.

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|蒲団}}
